message.content:
Below is a worked‐through example of how one can interpret and build the two sub‐structures exactly as shown, using only the orientations given in the block‐dictionary image (no rotating/flipping beyond what is shown). 

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1) ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
•  Overall Layout:
   – There are two separate “sub‐buildings.”  
   – The left “house”‐like tower has four visible pieces.  
   – The right “temple”‐like structure has eight visible pieces.

•  Left Sub‐Structure (“House”):
   – Layer/Block Count:
     1)  Bottom layer: a red arch block.  
     2)  Above it, a blue cube.  
     3)  A yellow half‐cylinder is perched bridging across the top surfaces.  
     4)  Topped by an orange “roof” block.  
   – Hence 4 blocks total in 4 vertical layers.

•  Right Sub‐Structure (“Temple”):
   – Base (1st layer):  
       – Far left: an orange wedge (sloping upward toward the center).  
       – Next inboard: a tall green rectangular block.  
       – Center: three vertical orange cylinders side‐by‐side.  
       – Next inboard on the right: another tall green rectangular block.  
       – Far right: a mirrored orange wedge (sloping upward toward the center).  
     So there are 7 blocks on the ground layer: 2 wedges, 2 tall green blocks, 3 cylinders.  
   – Top (2nd layer):
       – One orange “roof” block resting on the central cylinders, forming a triangular peak.  
     So 1 more block up top, for a total of 8 in the right sub‐structure.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2) SELECTING NEEDED BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Matching each shape/color/orientation to the dictionary yields:

•  Left “House” (4 blocks):
   – Red arch (arch opening left‐to‐right): block #1  
   – Blue cube: block #3  
   – Yellow half‐cylinder: block #9  
   – Orange roof‐shaped block: block #11  

•  Right “Temple” (8 blocks):
   – Orange wedge at far left: block #13  
   – Tall green rectangular block (left side): block #6  
   – Three vertical orange cylinders (center): block #7 (used 3 times)  
   – Tall green rectangular block (right side): block #6 (used again)  
   – Orange wedge at far right (mirrors #13): block #16  
   – Orange roof block on top: block #11 (used again)

Thus the required indices and quantities are:

 • #1  (×1)  
 • #3  (×1)  
 • #9  (×1)  
 • #6  (×2)  
 • #7  (×3)  
 • #11 (×2)  
 • #13 (×1)  
 • #16 (×1)  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3) STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is one plausible order (you can of course rearrange as long as the final stacking is the same):

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 1   // Red arch for left sub‐structure base
  Step2:  Move block with index 3   // Blue cube on top of arch
  Step3:  Move block with index 9   // Yellow half‐cylinder bridging the top
  Step4:  Move block with index 11  // Orange roof piece on the left “house”
  Step5:  Move block with index 13  // Orange wedge at far‐left of right structure
  Step6:  Move block with index 6   // Tall green rectangular (left side)
  Step7:  Move block with index 7   // First orange cylinder (center)
  Step8:  Move block with index 7   // Second orange cylinder
  Step9:  Move block with index 7   // Third orange cylinder
  Step10: Move block with index 6   // Tall green rectangular (right side)
  Step11: Move block with index 16  // Orange wedge at far‐right
  Step12: Move block with index 11  // Roof block on top of the cylinders
}

Following the above list exactly (with no extra rotations) reproduces the target arrangement.
